title: SQL vs. NoSQL: Which to Choose?
excerpt: Choosing the right database is a critical decision in application architecture. The main choice often comes down to SQL (relational) and NoSQL (non-relational) databases.
content:
## The Database Dilemma

Choosing the right database is a critical decision in application architecture. The main choice often comes down to SQL (relational) and NoSQL (non-relational) databases.

![Database comparison](https://placehold.co/600x300.png)

### SQL
Relational databases like PostgreSQL and MySQL use a structured schema and are excellent for applications requiring complex queries and transactional integrity.

### NoSQL
Non-relational databases like MongoDB and Redis offer flexibility in schema design and are often better for unstructured data and horizontal scalability.

title: Data Warehousing Concepts for Beginners
excerpt: A data warehouse is a central repository of information that can be analyzed to make more informed decisions.
content:
## What is a Data Warehouse?
A data warehouse is a central repository of information that can be analyzed to make more informed decisions. It aggregates data from various sources into a single, consistent data store to support business intelligence activities, reporting, and data analysis.
